pages.content: Halloween| is a holiday.| It is celebrated| on 31st| of October| every year.

WHAT DO| PEOPLE DO |TO CELEBRATE| HALLOWEEN?|
It’s the| perfect time| to be creative —| and creepy.| 
Kids| and adults| decorate| their houses| and yards| for Halloween| in spooky ways.
People| usually decorate| with ghosts,| skeletons,| spiders,| witches,| and pumpkins.
People| celebrate Halloween| by dressing up| in costumes.
Some people| dress up| in scary costumes| such as| ghosts,| witches,| or skeletons.
Some people| dress up| in fun costumes| like superheroes,| fairies,| or cartoon| characters.

Children| celebrate| the day| by going| trick-or-treating| at night.| They wear| costumes and| bring baskets,| go| from door| to door| saying| "Trick or treat".| The host| may give them| candies or| sweets,| in order not| to be teased,| or tricked.

Pumpkins| are the most| famous symbols| of Halloween.| Kids| can practice| carving|Jack- o - lanterns| from pumpkins.| Some of| the pumpkins| are carved| into faces.| Then| they put| a candle| inside to| light up.
There are| other interesting| activities| on Halloween| such as| picking apple| competitions,| visiting| haunted locations,| and telling| ghost stories.

WHAT DO| PEOPLE EAT| ON HALLOWEEN?|
People| enjoy eating| pumpkin soup,| pumpkin pie,| candy corn,| potato cakes,| and other| traditional food.| Children like| candy apples| very much.
Though| Halloween| is a joyful| festival,| it also| has a| great meaning.| It reminds us| of being generous,| being ready| to share| and help| people| around us.

Halloween| is so fun| for you| and me| and everyone.|
What do| you do| to celebrate| Halloween?
